learningPath.description: Build a strong understanding of UI/UX principles and methodologies.

dailyRoutine.task: Watch 2 hours of UI/UX design fundamentals videos on platforms like YouTube, Skillshare, or Udemy.
Complete interactive exercises and quizzes on websites like UX Collective or Interaction Design Foundation.
Read articles and blog posts from reputable sources like Nielsen Norman Group, UX Planet, or Smashing Magazine.
Practice design principles by creating simple wireframes and mockups using pen and paper or basic design tools.
Reflect on your learning and identify areas for improvement.

learningPath.description: Become proficient in using Figma for UI/UX design.

dailyRoutine.task: Complete Figma tutorials and workshops from platforms like Figma's official website, YouTube, or Skillshare.
Practice creating UI elements, layouts, and prototypes in Figma.
Explore advanced Figma features like plugins, libraries, and collaboration tools.
Participate in Figma community forums and ask questions to learn from experienced designers.
Review and critique your own work and seek feedback from peers or mentors.

learningPath.description: Apply your knowledge and skills to real-world UI/UX design projects.

dailyRoutine.task: Choose a UI/UX design project based on your interests or career goals.
Conduct user research, define user personas, and create user flows for your project.
Design wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using Figma.
Test your designs with users and gather feedback.
Iterate on your designs based on user feedback and refine your UI/UX solutions.

learningPath.description: Explore advanced UI/UX design concepts and techniques.

dailyRoutine.task: Learn about accessibility, usability testing, and A/B testing.
Study design patterns, micro-interactions, and animation principles.
Explore emerging UI/UX trends and technologies.
Network with other UI/UX designers and attend industry events.
Build a portfolio showcasing your best UI/UX design projects.
